I received a lot of messages about the Forbidden King. I thank you all. Travelers often say they like it.
This has already been confirmed with the awards that the Forbidden King received in the Oscar.
As you followed, I made a critical visit to Cairo last week.
Aside from the political prospect of this visit, the meeting with young people, the fervor of the popular revolution, was very interesting.
The Egyptian youth have used the power of social media so effectively that the old managers have not even had the opportunity to take precautions.
So much so that when I was talking to them, I saw one side of all their fingers working under the table. http://twitpic.com/46dvt3
They were constantly writing messages.
With Egyptian youth ... http://twitpic.com/46dwpy
Even later, I learned that my son Ahmet had followed the social media channel with my youths, tens of thousands of miles away.
With this incident, once again, I believe that:
It is not possible for any closed regime to survive in the long run in the face of this power that communication technologies have reached.
I also get a lot of messages about closing blogs. As far as I understand it, the law in this area must be passed through ...
and the rules must be amended so as not to give opportunity to collective punishment. I will also take the initiative in this direction.
#ILoveJordan b / c #JO is one big extended family. You never feel alone. Our doors are open; our hearts are open.
